item.title: 'Openly distributing money': Arvind Kejriwal writes to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, asks whether it supports - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal Questions RSS's Allegiance to BJP in a Letter

Publication Date: Not specified in the article
Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has written an open letter to RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat questioning whether the RSS supports the BJP's policies. This letter seeks clarity on the RSS's stance amid ongoing political tensions.

  • Kejriwal's letter addresses the collaboration between RSS and BJP.
  • He highlights the need for clarity on RSS's support for the BJP.
  • The letter raises concerns regarding the political implications of such support.
"We need to understand the RSS's position in the current political landscape."

This letter marks a notable attempt by Kejriwal to publicly challenge the RSS's influence in Indian politics.

item.title: PM Modi greets India on New Year - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi greets India on New Year

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Extending his greetings to the nation on the New Year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on January 1, 2025, expressed his hopes for new opportunities, success, and endless joy.

  • Modi wished for the year to bring health and prosperity for all.
  • President Droupadi Murmu also extended New Year greetings, urging collaboration for a brighter future.
  • Both leaders expressed hope for inclusiveness and sustainability in the New Year.
“Happy 2025! May this year bring everyone new opportunities, success and endless joy.” - PM Modi
“May the year 2025 bring joy, harmony and prosperity to all!” - President Droupadi Murmu

This New Year marks a time for reflection and hope, with leaders calling for unity and progress in the upcoming year.

item.title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: PM Modi extends New Year’s greetings, says ‘may this year bring new opportunities, success’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

As India celebrated the arrival of 2025 with unparalleled enthusiasm, Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended New Year’s greetings wishing for a year that brings new opportunities and success.

  • PM Modi hopes for health, prosperity, and joy for all in the New Year.
  • Celebrations include vibrant fireworks and family gatherings.
  • Major global cities like Sydney, London, and Tokyo welcomed the New Year with spectacular firework shows.
  • New York will host its famous Ball Drop with various performances.
  • Police deployed in major cities to manage crowds and ensure safety during celebrations.
“May everybody be blessed with wonderful health and prosperity,” - PM Modi

This New Year marks a time for hope, dreams, and new possibilities as the world joins together in celebration.

item.title: CM Biren Singh hits back at Congress' Jairam Ramesh over ‘sorry’ for Manipur unrest, targets former PMs - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Biren Singh Responds to Congress on Manipur Unrest and Apology

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh criticized Congress leader Jairam Ramesh's remarks regarding Prime Minister Modi's absence in Manipur amidst ongoing unrest.

  • Biren Singh attributes current turmoil in Manipur to Congress's past actions, including the settlement of Burmese refugees.
  • Jairam Ramesh questioned Modi's failure to visit and apologize to the people of Manipur.
  • Biren Singh expressed sincere grief for the victims and called for forgiveness.
  • He mentioned that the Naga-Kuki clashes had resulted in approximately 1,300 deaths and significant displacement.
  • Biren Singh challenged past Prime Ministers on their apologies for historical conflicts in Manipur.
“The apology I extended today was a sincere act of expressing my grief for the people who have been left displaced and became homeless.” - N Biren Singh

The ongoing ethnic clashes in Manipur, which began on May 3, 2023, have led to severe violence and a humanitarian crisis affecting thousands.

item.title: How a popular sarpanch’s murder sparked political firestorm in Maharashtra - The Times of India
item.description:
How a popular sarpanch’s murder sparked political firestorm in Maharashtra

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

The assassination of a prominent sarpanch in Maharashtra has ignited a political crisis, prompting widespread protests and governmental scrutiny.

  • The murder has led to unrest in the local community.
  • Political leaders are calling for justice and accountability.
  • The incident is reflective of broader issues in rural governance.
“This is a wake-up call for the authorities to ensure safety in local governance.”

In conclusion, the murder not only highlights the issues of safety for political figures in rural areas but also challenges the government to take immediate action to restore order.

item.title: Pushpita Gupta: ‘Nobody we can talk to now in Bangladesh… progressive Muslims have left or are hiding’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Pushpita Gupta: ‘Nobody we can talk to now in Bangladesh… progressive Muslims have left or are hiding’

Date & Source: October 2023, The Indian Express

Pushpita Gupta, a Labour Party Councillor and president of the Secular Bangladesh Movement UK, is currently in India with a delegation to discuss the safety and rights of Hindus in Bangladesh, emphasizing her commitment to advocate for her community amidst rising violence.

  • Gupta has been actively fighting for the rights of Hindus in Bangladesh for over 20 years.
  • She expresses concern over the current safety situation, noting that many progressive Muslims have fled or are hiding due to fear of reprisal.
  • Gupta has raised these issues with UK government officials, including MPs and the Foreign Secretary.
  • The response from UK MPs has been one of shock and concern, with discussions in Parliament about the need for action.
  • She calls for the Indian government to recognize the sacrifices of the Hindu community and take steps to protect them.
  • Gupta criticizes the role of the Bangladesh Army as biased against Hindus.
  • She expresses skepticism about upcoming elections, questioning the legitimacy of the current government.
“My message will be to protect my community, my families, the women in Bangladesh and children — they are suffering.”

In conclusion, Gupta appeals for international support to protect the rights and lives of Hindus in Bangladesh, highlighting the stark reality of fear and violence they face.

item.title: Nimisha Priya case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nimisha Priya case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have?

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Nimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala, has been sentenced to death in Yemen for the alleged murder of a Yemeni man in 2017. The Indian government is looking to extend assistance for her release.

  • Nimisha Priya was awarded the death sentence in 2020 and her appeal was rejected in November 2023.
  • The Indian Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has expressed commitment to help her family explore options for her release.
  • Negotiations may involve 'blood money' compensation to the victim's family, with significant funds required for this process.
  • The 'Save Nimisha Priya International Action Council' is raising funds for her release.
“It is still possible to hold talks with Mahdi’s family, convince them to pardon Priya possibly in exchange for blood money and secure her release.” - Subhash Chandran KR

The case highlights both the complexities of international law in Yemen and the plight of individuals entangled in foreign legal systems.

item.title: Modi’s Resilient Political Journey Is Far From Over. 2025 Will Be Proof - News18
item.description:
Modi’s Resilient Political Journey Is Far From Over. 2025 Will Be Proof

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi's political journey showcases his ability to connect with the masses and redefine political narratives, particularly in light of challenges faced in 2024.

  • Modi's leadership saw a resurgence in 2024 with key state victories despite local setbacks in the Lok Sabha.
  • The 'Pran Pratishtha' ceremony of the Ram Temple marked a significant moment of Hindu pride restoration.
  • Despite the BJP losing seats in the Lok Sabha, the party secured a historic third term due to strong state wins and alliance support.
  • Modi countered opposition narratives effectively, maintaining a focus on unity and strength leading into future elections.
  • Looking ahead to 2025, Modi's resilience and strategic acumen will be pivotal as opposition challenges intensify.
“Modi’s ability to rebound from setbacks is a hallmark of his political career.”

As 2024 concludes, Modi's political narrative strengthens, hinting at a continued significant presence in Indian politics into 2025.

item.title: ‘Footfall nowhere near what it used to be’: In Goa, shack owners say buzz from tourists is missing - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Footfall nowhere near what it used to be’: In Goa, shack owners say buzz from tourists is missing

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Beach shacks in Goa are facing a noticeable decline in tourist footfall, with owners expressing concerns over the lower occupancy rates during this festive season.

  • Despite licenses being issued early, shacks report low occupancy rates.
  • President of the Goa Shack Owners Welfare Society highlights a shift towards cheaper tourist destinations.
  • The government defends Goa's tourism, citing over 80 lakh domestic visitors in 2023.
  • Shack owners suggest more infrastructure improvements to attract higher-spending tourists.
  • Concerns about negative social media perceptions affecting tourism.
“Christmas used to be quite a busy time earlier...though the footfall has increased over the last few days, it is nowhere where it used to be.” - Cruz Cardozo

In conclusion, while there is a slight uptick in visitor numbers, the overall sentiment among shack owners reflects a worrying trend of declining foreign tourist engagement, prompting calls for improved infrastructure and positive repositioning of Goa as a tourist destination.

item.title: Report links India to anti-Muizzu plot, Maldives ex-prez denies it - The Times of India
item.description:
Report links India to anti-Muizzu plot, Maldives ex-prez denies it

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses allegations connecting India to a conspiracy against Maldives' ex-president Mohamed Muizzu. These claims have been firmly rejected by Muizzu, raising significant political tensions in the region.

  • The Maldives has seen increasing political instability.
  • Muizzu denies any involvement in a plotted coup.
  • Concerns over India's influence in Maldivian politics.
“These allegations are baseless and part of a larger smear campaign,” said Muizzu.

This situation highlights the ongoing geopolitical tensions and the complexities involved in the Maldives’ political landscape.

item.title: CM N Biren Singh apologises to Manipur strife victims, says drug smugglers, infiltrators from Myanmar top - The Times of India
item.description:
CM N Biren Singh apologises to Manipur strife victims, says drug smugglers, infiltrators from Myanmar top threats

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: The Economic Times

In a recent statement, Chief Minister N Biren Singh extended his apologies to the victims of strife in Manipur, highlighting the ongoing issues posed by drug smugglers and infiltrators from Myanmar as significant threats to the region's stability.

  • CM Singh expressed regret over the victims' suffering during the conflict in Manipur.
  • Identified drug trafficking and illegal infiltration as main challenges facing the state.
  • Stressed the need for coordinated efforts to address these threats.

item.title: Centre extending all help to Kerala nurse awarded death sentence in Yemen: MEA - The Times of India
item.description:
Centre extending all help to Kerala nurse awarded death sentence in Yemen: MEA

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

The Indian government is providing full support to a Kerala nurse who has been sentenced to death in Yemen.

  • The Minister of External Affairs assured that all necessary assistance will be extended.
  • The case has raised significant concern among Indian expatriates.
  • Authorities are working closely with local Yemeni officials regarding the situation.
"We will leave no stone unturned to assist her in this difficult time." - MEA Minister

The case highlights the challenges faced by Indian workers abroad, especially in conflict zones.

item.title: From Delhi, Jaipur to Pune, rampant misuse of Aadhaar uncovered in drives against illegal Bangladeshis - ThePrint
item.description:
From Delhi, Jaipur to Pune, rampant misuse of Aadhaar uncovered in drives against illegal Bangladeshis

Date: December 2024

Source: ThePrint

This article uncovers extensive misuse of Aadhaar cards connected to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants in India, revealing various patterns of fraud, police crackdowns, and a growing concern over security and identity verification.

  • Police raids have uncovered fraudulent Aadhaar cards linked to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants across several Indian cities.
  • In response to directives from Delhi's Lieutenant Governor, law enforcement is intensifying verification drives with significant results.
  • Illegal immigration rackets have been exposed, showing systematic procedures to acquire fake identification documents.
  • Notable cases include the aurrests of individuals in Jaipur and Delhi for producing counterfeit Aadhaar cards.
  • Deportations of illegal immigrants are occurring simultaneously with ongoing investigations.
“Under the guidance of @LtGovDelhi, team of @DCPSouthDelhi busted an illegal immigration racket, arresting 5 Bangladeshi Nationals and 6 accused involved in generating Aadhaar cards, voter IDs on the basis of fake birth certificates for Bangladeshi nationals.” - Delhi Police

The ongoing operations highlight increasing vigilance within Indian law enforcement to tackle illegal immigration and associated fraud through systemic verification of identities.

item.title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: India rings in 2025 with joyful celebrations across the nation - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

As the hour strikes midnight, India celebrates the arrival of 2025 with unparalleled enthusiasm and fervor. With vibrant celebrations at every corner, this marks the start of a new year full of hopes, dreams, and possibilities.

  • Major cities across the globe, from Sydney to London, will illuminate the welcome with firework shows.
  • New York is hosting its famous Ball Drop featuring performances from various artists including Kesha, T-Pain, and The Jonas Brothers.
  • In India, police are taking measures for safety, including diversions around Connaught Place and bans on firecrackers in Chennai.
“The atmosphere is one of joy and anticipation.”

This New Year’s celebration reflects not only the joy of the moment but also a hopeful vision for 2025.

item.title: New Year 2025: Are banks closed on January 1, 2025? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Are Banks Closed on New Year's Day 2025?

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

As we approach the new year, many citizens are curious about banking operations on January 1, 2025 (Wednesday). Understanding bank holiday schedules is crucial for financial planning and managing personal transactions during the festive season.

  • Banks in India are expected to be open on January 1, 2025, as no clear direction from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been issued yet.
  • Bank holidays vary by state; for example, banks in West Bengal will observe a statewide closure on New Year’s Day.
  • Banks will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except in Mizoram and Sikkim.
  • Online banking and ATMs will still be available for cash withdrawals during closures.
“Banks across India will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except for banks in Mizoram and Sikkim.”

It’s essential to check with local bank branches for their specific holiday calendars to be informed about banking operations during the new year.

item.title: Live Updates | Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations: Countdown To Midnight Begins; India Set To Welcome - Zee News
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Live Updates

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: Zee News

As 2024 draws to a close, we stand on the cusp of a brand-new year, ready to welcome 2025 with open arms, symbolizing fresh opportunities and new beginnings.

  • New Year's Day falls on January 1, 2025, which is a Wednesday.
  • The celebrations feature dazzling fireworks and public gatherings in cities around the world.
  • Famous events include the Ball Drop in New York with performances from popular artists.
  • Global cities illuminate the skies with firework displays.
“This transition brings a sense of hope and renewal.”

The arrival of 2025 is marked by celebrations across India and worldwide, gathering people to reflect on the past year and set aspirations for the future.

item.title: Yemen death sentence for Kerala woman: India adopting a cautious route in conflict-hit Sanaa - The Hindu
item.description:
India Treads Cautiously on Yemen Death Sentence of Kerala Woman

Published on: December 31, 2024, Source: The Hindu

India is cautiously addressing the sensitive case of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala woman sentenced to death in Yemen for the murder of her Yemeni business partner, amid the complexities of operating in regions controlled by the Houthi faction.

  • Nimisha Priya has been sentenced to death after being convicted of killing her business partner in Yemen.
  • The Yemeni conflict involves multiple factions, complicating the legal and diplomatic situation.
  • India does not have official communication with the Houthis, raising challenges for intervention.
  • Negotiations may be underway for a possible settlement based on Yemeni customs of blood money.
“The government is extending all possible help in the matter,” said Mr. Jaiswal.

This case highlights the intricate intersection of legal processes, international relations, and local conflict in Yemen.

item.title: 'Serious Breach Of Oath, Insults Constitution': Kerala CM On Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks - News18
item.description:
Kerala CM Condemns Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: News18

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan strongly criticized Maharashtra BJP Minister Nitesh Rane for his remarks calling Kerala a 'mini-Pakistan', stating that such comments are a serious breach of oath and insult to the Constitution.

  • The CM labeled Rane's comments as highly provocative and unacceptable.
  • Opposition leaders in Kerala have demanded Rane's resignation over the remarks.
  • CM Vijayan emphasized that such statements are part of a larger hate propaganda by the Sangh Parivar aimed at alienating Kerala.
  • The political controversy sparked by Rane's statement has drawn severe criticism and calls for accountability from opposition parties.
“The minister who made the hateful statement does not deserve to continue in that position.” - Pinarayi Vijayan

The controversy around Nitesh Rane’s remarks reflects ongoing tensions in political discourse in India, especially regarding communal relations and regional perceptions.

item.title: Quad vows to work vigorously towards free, stable Indo-Pacific - The Hindu
item.description:
Quad vows to work vigorously towards free, stable Indo-Pacific

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

India and the other Quad member nations reaffirmed their commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific amid increasing military tensions from China.

  • The Quad group consists of India, the U.S., Australia, and Japan.
  • The joint statement marks the 20th anniversary of Quad cooperation.
  • The coalition began with a response to the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami.
  • Future initiatives will focus on responding to regional needs in maritime security and infrastructure.
  • India is set to host the next Quad Summit in the second half of 2025.
The tsunami was one of the worst disasters in history, claiming the lives of nearly a quarter million people and displacing 1.7 million across 14 countries.

The Quad's commitment to humanitarian assistance and disaster relief remains strong, addressing complex challenges from climate change to cybersecurity.

item.title: Government websites down after outage at NIC data centre in Delhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Government websites down after outage at NIC data centre in Delhi

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Several government websites went down on December 31, 2024, due to a power outage at the National Informatics Centre's data centre, impacting services and causing disruptions for the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) website.

  • Government websites went offline following a power outage at NIC data centre in Delhi.
  • IRCTC site disruptions affected last-minute ticket purchases for trains.
  • Other affected websites include those of DoT, MEA, PIB, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Labour.
  • Some sites remained down until 7.30 PM, while others continued to show error messages.
“The IRCTC site was not accessible during the tatkal booking period…”

As multiple government websites faced outages, the situation highlights the vulnerability of digital infrastructure in the context of public services.

item.title: No talk with me, India won’t back any regime change move in Maldives: Nasheed - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nasheed Responds to Claims of Indian Involvement in Maldives Regime Change

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: The Indian Express

Former President of Maldives, Mohamed Nasheed, addressed reports of a supposed plot involving Indian intelligence and the Maldivian Opposition to oust current President Mohamed Muizzu. He clarified that India would not support such efforts.

  • Nasheed refutes claims that he was involved in talks for regime change supported by India.
  • Reports suggest a plan to bribe MPs and military officials to impeach President Muizzu.
  • Indian government sources denied any involvement, labeling the report a “figment of imagination”.
“I do not believe that India will be willing to assist the Maldives Opposition in regime change and they certainly have never had any such conversation with me,” Nasheed stated.

Nasheed emphasizes India's respect for Maldivian democracy and highlights the importance of strengthening democratic processes in the Maldives.

item.title: Jaishankar in Doha for talks, to prepare for Qatari Emir visit in February amidst West Asia outreach - The Hindu
item.description:
Jaishankar in Doha for talks, to prepare for Qatari Emir visit in February amidst West Asia outreach

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 09:12 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar is in Doha for a 3-day visit to prepare for the upcoming visit of Qatar’s Emir Sheikh Tamim ibn Hamad Al Thani to India, amid ongoing tensions in the Gulf region.

  • Jaishankar's visit includes meetings with officials to discuss various diplomatic ties including trade, investment, and security.
  • The Emir is expected to visit India early next month as part of India’s outreach to the Gulf.
  • Jaishankar's visit also raises hope for the return of a former Naval officer detained in Qatar.
  • The family of the detained officer has pleaded with the Indian government for intervention.
“MEA made blunder in leaving my brother alone & now they should not take refuge by citing his financial case.” - Meetu Bhargava, sister of the detained officer

This visit is part of a larger strategy to strengthen ties with the Gulf amidst a crises impacting multiple regions.
